1.title: Garcelle Beauvais
1.plot: Garcelle Beauvais discusses life after divorce, dating in LA, raising children, and keeping a career in Hollywood.

2.title: Greg Louganis
2.plot: Greg Louganis, Olympian, talks about his achievements, shortcomings, and how he's overcome adversity throughout his life.

3.title: Lawrence Zarian
3.plot: Lawrence Zarian, TV style guru, shares with Ashley his deep spiritual journey, his thoughts on mediation, and how he has stayed the course while being on TV and living in Hollywood. After the switch, Lawrence asks Ashley a deeply personal question that brings her to tears. Later, on Your Daily Perspective, Ashley exposes how we judge our self based on the perceived success of others and how we can end this self critical cycle.

4.title: Tony Denison
4.plot: Tony Denison tells about his personal connection with his character Andy Flynn on the hit show Major Crimes. Tony explains how he has stayed true to himself by doing the soul work to prevent losing himself in Hollywood. Tony talks about his love even addiction for cooking, and how one night on a hundred plus mile road trip for oyster sauce, he decided he may need to reel his love for cooking back in. Tony reveals how to tap into your authentic self and how he centers his energy to be in the moment no matter what he's working on. Tony shares his love for giving back ...

5.title: Natalie Burn
5.plot: Natalie Burn discusses her love of action films and how she parlayed her dancing ability and applied it to film. She discusses her knife fighting and her training in jiu-jitsu and how she loves to empower others to get out of their comfort zone. Natalie and Ashley talk about how their parents were singers and Natalie reveals how her father told her she didn't have a voice and how it killed her inside. Natalie discusses why it's important to find the uniqueness within you and why following your dreams are important. She also explains how to ignore the naysayers and ...

6.title: Chloe Hurst
6.plot: Chloe Hurst, actress and supermodel, tells her story of moving from Australia to Los Angeles and how she used her fear to propel herself forward instead of allowing it to hold her back. Being blessed with a sense of confidence her entire life, coming from within and support from her family, Chloe helps others to find their inner confidence and helps them to realize they are enough. Later, Chloe talks about what friendship really means and she speaks about the value of education and her friend's organization Pencils for Promise. Chloe wants to help people with self ...

7.title: Wil Traval
7.plot: Wil Traval, Australian actor in Hollywood discusses his character Nuke on the Netflix series of Jessica Jones. Wil also explains how he finds a part of himself in every role he plays. Wil explains how important exercise is for him in his daily life and how it helps him have more self understanding and puts life issues into perspective. Wil and Ashley discuss life's wake-up calls, and Wil is reminded of his best friend who committed suicide and how it impacted him in such a way that he made significant life changes. After his friend's death, Wil takes a trip to South ...

8.title: Carrie Preston
8.plot: Carrie Preston, Emmy-winning actress, discusses her acting philosophy, her personal life, and how she gives back. Carrie Preston discusses her childhood and how she would put on backyard plays at her parent's home and how supportive her mom was about her wanting to be an actress. Carrie shares her philosophy on being a successful Emmy award winning actress and how it's not just talent but it's the training that makes an actor great. Carrie discusses her personal life, her marriage to Michael Emerson, and their dog Chumley. Carrie tells about the importance of giving ...

9.title: Genevieve Buechner
9.plot: Genevieve Buechner, UnREAL, explains what it's like to be an introvert in Hollywood and what she looks for in a friend. Genevieve Buechner discusses her role as Madison in the TV show UnREAL. Genevieve expresses her love for travel and how she enjoys seeing how other people live and to be emerged in different cultures. Genevieve talks about being raised in Vancouver and how it's extremely different from Los Angeles. She also reveals that she doesn't have a driver's license. Genevieve explains how she is an introvert and what that means in regards to going out, needing...

10.title: Keesha Sharp
10.plot: Keesha Sharp, Lethal Weapon, discusses her character, Trish Murtaugh, and how Trish and her have several similarities, marriage, family, and helping others. Keesha explains the different love languages and how understanding those languages have benefited her marriage. Keesha asks Ashley how to be authentic and still network with others.

imdb.plot outline: A Celebrity talk show where intimate and authentic conversations are organically created between Ashley Berges, host, and her selected celebrity guests. A quarter way through the show the celebrity and Ashley switch seats on camera. The 'unique twist' comes midway through the one-on-one interview. The celebrity takes over the host chair and asks Ashley's advice on issues affecting their lives such as divorce, marriage, relationships, self esteem and navigating through life in the disruptive celebrity spotlight in the segment named Q&Ashley. Ashley's innate ability to open people up to speak their truth allows viewers to dive into the lives, the joys, and pitfalls, of their favorite celebrities. Each episode is light, fun, and entertaining and at moments deep and revealing. After Q&Ashley, the host speaks directly into the camera in a segment named, Your Daily Perspective, where she offers viewers real life advice on how to overcome adversity, complimented with uplifting motivation, and authentic perspective for ways to live a true life. In the last segment, Live Your True Life Moments, Ashley shares impactful and inspirational stories of individuals who have faced life's challenges and their unique journey that led to them overcoming adversity.
